panels.description: System details for each discovered edgerouter device
panels.title: System Information

panels.description: The time since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.
panels.title: Uptime

panels.description: The number of user sessions for which this host is storing state information. A session is a collection of processes requiring a single act of user authentication and possibly subject to collective job control.
panels.title: Users

panels.description: The number of process contexts currently loaded or running on this system.
panels.title: Processes

panels.description: The 1,5 and 15 minute load averages.
panels.title: CPU Load Average

panels.description: Number of context switches, and interrupts processed.
panels.title: Interrupts / Ctx-Switches (/sec)

panels.description: Number of blocks sent to, or received from, a block device.
panels.title: Block I/O (/sec)

panels.description: Percentage of CPU time spent by state.

targets.expr: increase(ssCpuRawUser{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) / (increase(ssCpuRawUser{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawNice{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSystem{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawIdle{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval])  + increase(ssCpuRawWait{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawKernel{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawInterrupt{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSoftIRQ{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]))

increase(ssCpuRawNice{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) / (increase(ssCpuRawUser{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawNice{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSystem{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawIdle{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval])  + increase(ssCpuRawWait{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawKernel{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawInterrupt{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSoftIRQ{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]))

increase(ssCpuRawSystem{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) / (increase(ssCpuRawUser{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawNice{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSystem{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawIdle{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval])  + increase(ssCpuRawWait{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawKernel{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawInterrupt{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSoftIRQ{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]))

increase(ssCpuRawIdle{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) / (increase(ssCpuRawUser{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawNice{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSystem{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawIdle{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval])  + increase(ssCpuRawWait{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawKernel{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawInterrupt{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSoftIRQ{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]))

increase(ssCpuRawWait{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) / (increase(ssCpuRawUser{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawNice{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSystem{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawIdle{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval])  + increase(ssCpuRawWait{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawKernel{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawInterrupt{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSoftIRQ{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]))

increase(ssCpuRawKernel{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) / (increase(ssCpuRawUser{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawNice{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSystem{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawIdle{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval])  + increase(ssCpuRawWait{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawKernel{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawInterrupt{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSoftIRQ{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]))

increase(ssCpuRawSoftIRQ{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) / (increase(ssCpuRawUser{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawNice{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSystem{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawIdle{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval])  + increase(ssCpuRawWait{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawKernel{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawInterrupt{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]) + increase(ssCpuRawSoftIRQ{job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: CPU Time

panels.description: The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle.
panels.title: Processor Load (1 Min Average)

panels.description: The total amount of real or virtual memory currently allocated, by type.
panels.title: Memory Distribution

panels.description: The amount of real/physical memory currently unused or available.
panels.title: Memory Available

panels.description: The amount of physical memory which is currently allocated.

targets.expr: hrStorageUsed{hrStorageDescr="Physical memory",job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"} / hrStorageSize{hrStorageDescr="Physical memory",job=~"$job", instance=~"$instance", snmp_target=~"$snmp_target"}

panels.title: IP Distribution

panels.description: Number of IP datagrams by direction and IP version.

panels.description: Number of IP datagrams dropped, or in error, by reason, direction, and IP version.
panels.title: IP Non-Forwarding Drops/Errors

panels.description: Number of TCP connections by type.
panels.title: TCP State Transitions (/sec)

panels.description: The number of TCP connections for which the current state is either ESTABLISHED or CLOSE-WAIT.
panels.title: TCP Sessions

panels.description: Total number of TCP segments by type and direction.
panels.title: TCP Traffic, Non-Forward (seg/sec)

panels.description: Number of UDP datagrams sent and recieved, in error, or without destination application on port.

panels.description: Number of ICMP messages and errors by direction and IP version.

panels.description: Number of SNMP packets and requests by direction and type.

panels.title: SNMP Objects Fetched (/sec)
